title: SCP-8925
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:black-highlighter-theme]]

[[module css]]
.addendumblock
{
    display: block;
    border: solid 1px #303034;
    background: #DDDDDD;
}
.checkblock
{
    display: block;
    border: solid 1px #111111;
    background: #642E2C;
    color: #EEEEEE;
}
.addendumblock .entrytag
{
   width: 90%;
   margin-left: auto;
   margin-right: auto;
   margin-top: 5%
}
.blockquote
{
   border: solid 1px !important;
   background: #FFFFFF !important;
}

/* RESPONSIVE */

@media screen and (max-width: 900px)
{
   .blockquote
   {
       width:70% !important;
       margin-left:auto !important;
       margin-right:auto !important;
   }
}

[[/module]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

**Item #:** SCP-8925

**Object Class:** Safe

**Special Containment Procedures:** SCP-8925 is kept within meeting room 1-23-109 of Site-40, where it was discovered. Junior Researcher[[footnote]]Title honorarily attributed[[/footnote]] Sylvan Harrington is not to be disturbed while filling out SCP-8925. Containment and long-term study of SCP-8925 is currently ensured by Jr. Rsr. Harrington's inability to free themselves of its effect; this state has been largely self-maintaining.

**Description:** SCP-8925 is a copy of a Foundation employee introduction form printed as part of an August 2005 recruitment drive. It is physically indistinguishable from any other reproduction of its template.
@@ @@
SCP-8925 induces a poorly understood memetic compulsion in those who view it/attempt to fill it out[[footnote]]Due to Jr. Rsr. Harrington being the first and only victim of SCP-8925, the nature and extent of its effects are mostly conjecture.[[/footnote]], preventing the subject from directing their attention away from the task of completing it. Attempting to disrupt this effect has been entirely unsuccessful, though deemed undesirable. It is currently theorized that completion of the form would nullify its effects, although what constitutes "completion" is uncertain.
@@ @@

**Addendum 1 - --Weekly-- (Monthly as of 29/08/2007) Completion Report:** A record of SCP-8925's completion progress by Jr. Rsr. Harrington, updated and compiled every month for study. Records in which no important changes have occurred have been omitted.

**Addendum 2 - Recontainment Procedure:**
In the event that Jr. Rsr. Harrington is no longer affected by SCP-8925, they are to be assigned a starter project per standard personnel induction procedures and the item moved to a low-security containment locker, pending experimentation. Jr. Rsr. Harrington's answers will not be reviewed for admission.
@@ @@
@@ @@
